data.title: EXCLUSIVE: HUGH AND JEMIMA SPLIT
data.meta_description: HUGH Grant and Jemima Khan have split after three turbulent years together.
data.text:
WATCH out ladies - because heart-throb Hugh Grant is single again.

Yes, love has actually crumbled once more for the stuttering one - leaving the rest of the world wondering exactly why Hugh cannot hang on to his women.

The 46-year-old star and mum-of-two Jemima, 33, gave no reason for the break-up after three turbulent years together.

But it follows public rows over Hugh's roving eye and close relationship with his ex Liz Hurley. Ironically, Hugh never felt able to settle down with Liz, despite a 13-year relationship

The actor's publicist Robert Garlock last night confirmed his relationship with Jemima was over. He said: "Hugh and Jemima have decided to split amicably."

The couple have also been plagued by arguments about Hugh's reluctance to commit himself to a long-term relationship.

Jemima was keen to establish a settled family life for her and her two young sons from her marriage to cricket legend Imran Khan.

She and Hugh bought an #18million home in Chelsea, West London, but marriage proposals never came. This month, the couple had a spat over his flirting at the premiere party of his film Music and Lyrics.

Jemima told a friend: "He's ignoring me. He's got lots of other women on his arm tonight.

"I knew this would happen. I'm used to it now."

Hugh was overheard saying: "I can't kiss any more women, I've already had a row with Jemima."

Mind you, that didn't stop him wandering up to several women at Floridita, in London's Soho, and saying: "You're simply gorgeous, aren't you?" At her birthday party in January, Jemima joked with a guest about Hugh's reluctance to commit.

He responded by branding her "a nag" and "a dictator".

Weeks earlier, the couple were seen having a slanging match on Sunset Boulevard - the Los Angeles street where Hugh was infamously caught in a car with hooker Divine Brown.

Hugh began dating Jemima four years after splitting from Liz.

Relations between the two women have always been frosty.

But they reached an all-time low two years ago after Liz seductively sucked Hugh's finger at a ball thrown by Elton John.

Jemima and Hugh did not receive an invite to Hurley's forthcoming wedding to businessman Arun Nayer.

Hugh recently confessed that his screen image as romantic comedy hero was a long way from real life. He said: "I am really not the romantic sort.

"Maybe deep inside there is a little romance lingering but I cannot think of a single thing I have ever done which could be construed as romantic.

"Even if I could, however, I wouldn't divulge it as the whole thing makes me cringe."
